<var 1E 0B /var> Set to Hotbar <var 1E 0C /var> Edit Minion Hotbar <var 1E 09 /var> Summon

<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Learn Your Structures<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Arcana Stones<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> You and your opponent each have three of these immobile crystals on the playing field. Shatter all of your enemy's Arcana Stones to claim victory. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Gates<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Minions will appear in front of your currently selected gate. Returning minions to a gate area will restore their HP. Minions can still be summoned from a destroyed gate, but they will be unable to exit the gate area. Conversely, minions outside a destroyed gate will be unable to enter. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Search Eye<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> This structure reveals your opponent's minions. If the Search Eye is destroyed, you will only be able to see enemy units that are near your own minions. <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Shield<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> This structure adds defensive strength to Arcana Stones. Destroy the enemy Shield and your opponent's Arcana Stones will be more easily shattered.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Structural Regeneration<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> All structures except for Arcana Stones can only be temporarily destroyed. Their various functions will reactivate at full strength after a certain amount of time has passed. ※Positioning your minions near a destroyed structure will hasten the reactivation process.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Play to Your Minions' Strengths<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Each variety of minion is capable of inflicting greater damage against certain structures. Learn each unit's strengths, and pick the right minion for the job!
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Turn the Tide with Special Actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> These conditions must be met before a special action can be used: ・Four minions of the same variety are gathered in an action party ・Each minion in the action party has full action points (Action points accumulate over time) To perform a special action, select an individual minion from the action party, and press the Execute Action button on the minion hotbar.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Mastering Traps<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Some minions will place traps with their special actions. A trap will become armed ten seconds after it has been placed, and it can then be triggered by pressing the Trigger Trap button on the minion hotbar. ※Only one trap can be placed at a time.
<var 08 E1E95101 ((<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Playing with a <var 08 E1E94C01 ((Controller)) ((Gamepad)) /var><var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Selecting Minions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・Selecting an individual minion <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 1E 08 /var> : Select minion from party list ・Selecting multiple minions <var 1E 0C /var> : Activate selection circle and select targeted minions <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Useful Commands<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・General <var 12 12 /var> : Switch summoning gate <var 1E 10 /var> : Toggle minion party list display <var 12 11 /var> : Select summoning queue <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 12 0B /var> : Execute special action <var 1E 0E /var>＋<var 1E 15 /var> : Move ground target pointer <var 1E 0E /var>＋<var 12 11 /var> : Reset ground target pointer <var 1E 13 /var> : Display help ・Minion Selection <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 12 09 /var> : Select all minions near currently selected minion <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 12 0C /var> : Select all nearby minions of same variety as currently selected minion <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 12 0A /var> : Select all minions of same variety as currently selected minion ・Minimap Controls <var 1E 0F /var> while pressed : Record map jump point (release button to jump) <var 1E 0F /var>＋<var 1E 18 /var> : Map jump point selection <var 1E 0F /var>＋<var 12 12 /var> : Restore map jump point defaults
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Mouse Controls<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Selecting Minions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Left-Click : Select individual minion ※Left-clicking on your currently selected minion will select all nearby minions of the same variety. Left-Click + Drag : Select all minions in the selection square )) ((<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Mouse Controls<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Selecting Minions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Left-Click : Select individual minion ※Left-clicking on your currently selected minion will select all nearby minions of the same variety. Left-Click + Drag : Select all minions in the selection square
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Playing with a <var 08 E1E94C01 ((Controller)) ((Gamepad)) /var><var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Selecting Minions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・Selecting an individual minion <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 1E 08 /var> : Select minion from party list ・Selecting multiple minions <var 1E 0C /var> : Activate selection circle and select targeted minions <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Useful Commands<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> ・General <var 12 12 /var> : Switch summoning gate <var 1E 10 /var> : Toggle minion party list display <var 12 11 /var> : Select summoning queue <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 12 0B /var> : Execute special action <var 1E 0E /var>＋<var 1E 15 /var> : Move ground target pointer <var 1E 0E /var>＋<var 12 11 /var> : Reset ground target pointer <var 1E 13 /var> : Display help ・Minion Selection <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 12 09 /var> : Select all minions near currently selected minion <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 12 0C /var> : Select all nearby minions of same variety as currently selected minion <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 12 0A /var> : Select all minions of same variety as currently selected minion ・Minimap Controls <var 1E 0F /var> while pressed : Record map jump point (release button to jump) <var 1E 0F /var>＋<var 1E 18 /var> : Map jump point selection <var 1E 0F /var>＋<var 12 12 /var> : Restore map jump point defaults )) /var> <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Keyboard Shortcuts<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> The following keybinds will be assigned different functions while playing Lord of Verminion. <var 08 E4E94C02 (()) (( Hotbar 1 - Slots 1 to 12 : Minion hotbar bottom row Hotbar 2 - Slots 1 to 12 : Minion hotbar top row Hotbar 3 - Slot 1 : Execute Action Hotbar 3 - Slot 2 : Trigger Trap Hotbar 3 - Slot 3 : Withdraw Minion )) /var> Draw/Sheathe Weapon : Switch summoning gate Minion Guide : Battle List

When using the performance actions, you are strictly prohibited from performing the music of any third parties. You may record and upload your performance and hereby agree to license such recordings to us for use by Square Enix or others in accordance with the terms of the “FINAL FANTASY XIV Material Usage License”.

<var 1E 18 /var> Scroll <var 1E 0C /var> Switch Type <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 1E 0B /var> Toggle Floor <var 1E 0D /var>＋<var 1E 18 /var> Zoom <var 1E 09 /var> Teleport

You may challenge previously completed main scenario dungeons of level 71 and above with a party of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>NPC avatars<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Avatars will gain EXP and level up in accordance with their duty participation.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※When using Trust, coffers found in the duty will contain fewer items. In addition, some enemies will no longer drop rewards.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

The glamour system will be unlocked for NPC avatars who have attained level 80. Use the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Glamour<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> icons or subcommand from the party selection window to adjust character appearances.
It should be noted that certain avatars may not be permitted to accompany you into some instanced dungeons.

You may challenge a dungeon via two different methods: by calling upon the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>support of trusty NPCs<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, or by forming a party <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>with other players<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Player parties may be preformed or assigned via the Duty Finder. No matter what method you choose, the duty that awaits will offer comparable difficulty and experience.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※When challenging a duty with NPCs, coffers will contain fewer items. In addition, some enemies will no longer drop rewards.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

By choosing <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Support<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> under <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu, or by accessing the entrance of any applicable duty, you can summon a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>team of NPC allies<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to assist you. NPC parties will be <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>automatically balanced<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to suit your current class or job. Once you have made your preparations, select <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Register for Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and ready yourself for battle!

Once you have registered and your duty is available, a prompt window indicated by a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>notification sound<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear. Begin duty by selecting <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Commence<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Please note that if you do not commence duty within the time limit, your registration will be automatically withdrawn, and you must start the process over.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Over the course of your adventures, the number of duties available to you will gradually increase. Should you encounter a duty for which NPC support is not available, access the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> to team up with other players instead. You may also rechallenge previously cleared duties by using either the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Support<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, both accessible via <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu.

When challenging main scenario duties of level 71 and above, you may choose your favorite <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>support NPCs<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> with which to form a party. Click on a member of your current party to see all <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>members available for selection<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.

The <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> allows you to challenge dungeons and other duties with a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>party of other players<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. You may access it via <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu, or by choosing the appropriate option at the entrance of any duty.

Enter dungeons and other duties via the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> by choosing your desired duty, then selecting <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Join<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. You will then be automatically matched with compatible players destined for the same duty.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※You may register for up to five duties at one time. ※Duties marked by a lock symbol require certain conditions to be met before becoming accessible.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

When you register for a duty, it will appear along with an icon in your duty list. You may check <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>duty status<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, including matching progress and approximate waiting times, by selecting this entry.

Once you have been successfully matched with other players, a prompt window indicated by a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>notification sound<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> will appear. Begin duty by selecting <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Commence<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
<var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>※Please note that if you do not commence duty within the time limit, your registration will be automatically withdrawn, and you must start the process over.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>

Over the course of your adventures, the number of duties available to you will gradually increase. Many duties can be cleared via both the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> and <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Support<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> systems, so it's worth familiarizing yourself with both. You may also rechallenge previously cleared dungeons by accessing <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty Support<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> via <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu.

※Keyboard/Mouse settings listed are default. <var 08 E4E94C01 (( <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Move Camera<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> <var 1E 15 /var> Stick/[W, A, S, D] Keys (Movement)

The following conditions must be met to use the Duty Recorder: 1. Recorder is enabled. 2. Current duty is available for recording. 3. Parties meet minimum size requirements. 4. Record ready check has been executed.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>1. Recorder settings are enabled<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Recorder settings can be adjusted under <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Duty Recorder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>2. Current duty is available for recording<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Not all duties are available for recording. Recordable duties are marked with a special icon.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>3. Parties meet minimum size requirements<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Duties undertaken by undersized parties cannot be recorded. ※This includes parties formed via the Duty Finder. ※Duties with the unrestricted party setting enabled cannot be recorded, even if minimum party size requirements are met.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>4. Record ready check has been executed<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Approval from all party members is required before recording can begin. ※Record ready checks must be performed within 5 minutes of commencing a duty.
Only 3 records may be saved at once. Oldest records will be overwritten. ※Up to 2 records can be protected at once.

The following conditions must be met to view duty records: 1. You are in an inn room. 2. Recorded duty is from the most recent game version.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>1. You are in an inn room<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Duty playback is only available in inn rooms.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>2. Recorded duty is from the most recent game version<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> This includes both major updates and minor hotfixes. Recordings will become inaccessible after applying the newest data patch.

<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Pause<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Temporarily stop playback.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Chapter Selection<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Start playback at the position selected. ※Depending on chapter position, playback may not be instantaneous.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Next Chapter<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Skip to the next available chapter.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Previous Chapter<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Skip to the previous chapter.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>HUD Display<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Toggle on/off on-screen UI elements. ※Settings are saved for next playback.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Focus Target<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Displays focus target information for the selected target.
<var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Exit<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> Exit playback.

Fellowships are gatherings of players who share common interests. With up to 1,000 members permitted in each fellowship, they provide an excellent way to connect and socialize with like-minded adventurers.
Anyone can create their own fellowship or become a member of another. Fellowships are cross-world, and you can belong to a maximum of ten at any given time.
To search for fellowships that are currently recruiting, select <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Social<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> from the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>main menu<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and then <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Fellowship Finder<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
Each fellowship is led by a master, who can grant administrative rights to other members to assist them. The master role automatically falls to the fellowship's founder, but it can also be transferred to another.
Join a fellowship or create your own, and gain access to its myriad benefits!

■Message of the Day Leave a message for fellowship members to see, be it a motto, an announcement, or something random. Messages can be posted by the master and admin members.
■Poll Polls can be created by the fellowship master and admin members. All members are eligible to cast one vote per poll.
■Notices Post up to five notices at a time. This feature is available only to the fellowship master and admin members.

All fellowship members can post comments to the message board.
Up to 100 comments are displayed, with the oldest being deleted first. The fellowship master and admin members can delete comments at any time.
* Characters on the free trial cannot post to the message board during their first 14 days as a fellowship member.

Displays the list of fellowship members. Here you can carry out various administrative tasks such as appointing admin members and transferring master privileges.
It is also possible to blacklist players. Doing so removes them from the fellowship and prevents them from rejoining in the future.

■Settings This menu is accessible only to the master. Here you can rename the fellowship, set the fellowship's activities, manage the blacklist, and disband the fellowship.
■Recruitment Under this menu, you can recruit new members to the fellowship. Recruitment ends either when the target is reached, one week has elapsed, or the recruiter chooses to cancel the process.
■Admin The master can appoint admin members to assist in the management of the fellowship. Master privileges can only be transferred to an admin member. Furthermore, in order for the master to leave their fellowship, they must transfer their privileges first.
This menu displays the fellowships that are currently recruiting members, with the option to filter by activities and language.

<var 48 F20202 /var>■Performance Actions: Important Information<var 48 01 /var> When using the performance actions, you are strictly prohibited from performing the music of any third parties. You may record and upload your performance and hereby agree to license such recordings to us for use by Square Enix or others in accordance with the terms of the “FINAL FANTASY XIV Material Usage License”.

<var 48 F20202 /var>■Overview<var 48 01 /var> Ensemble mode makes it easier for you and your party members to play in sync for the benefit of your audience.
<var 48 F20202 /var>■Playback Differences between Performance and Ensemble Mode<var 48 01 /var> When ensemble mode is enabled, all party members will be heard in sync by players in the vicinity, but there will be a delay between the inputs and the sounds being heard by those performing, according to the playback type. Those who select “Self Only” will only hear their own instrument, while “All Members” plays the instruments of all members with an increased delay. ※“Playback Type” can be found in ensemble mode's settings menu.
<var 48 F20202 /var>■Entering Ensemble Mode<var 48 01 /var> Follow the steps below to enter ensemble mode. 1. Select “Ensemble Ready Check” from the metronome menu. 2. With “Enter Ensemble Mode” enabled, select Begin. 3. Once all party members have responded to the ready check, you will enter ensemble mode.
<var 48 F20202 /var>■Ensemble Mode Requirements<var 48 01 /var> Ensemble mode can only be used if the following conditions have been met: 1. The party leader is using Performance mode. 2. All party members are in an area where Performance actions can be used. Ensemble mode cannot be used in inn rooms or Grand Company barracks. 3. Each area has a limit on the number of ensembles that can be present at any given time. If this limit has been reached, you will not be able to use ensemble mode in that area.

<var 48 F20202 /var>■Performance Assistance<var 48 01 /var> This feature helps you to play along with a number of songs, with the timings and key presses displayed as you perform.
<var 48 F20202 /var>■Using Performance Assistance<var 48 01 /var> Follow the steps below to use Performance Assistance. 1. Select Performance Assistance from the Performance menu. 2. Select a song. 3. You may select the playback speed and whether or not to use a metronome.
<var 48 F20202 /var>■Important<var 48 01 /var> If a party member initiates an ensemble mode ready check while you are using Performance Assistance, a “No” response will be sent automatically. For this reason, it is not advisable to use Performance Assistance while in a party.

<var 48 08 /var><var 49 04 /var>The rules of engagement on the Bozjan southern front are different than what you will have encountered before. The following pages contain a detailed explanation of what you may expect on the battlefield.<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
<var 48 0F /var>Read and understand them well if you would gain the upper hand over the Empire's IVth Legion.<var 48 01 /var>

<var 48 08 /var><var 49 04 /var>■Level Sync<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Though it is possible to join the Bozjan southern front beginning at level 71, all players will be synced to level 80 while in duty. Item level will also be synced accordingly.
<var 48 0F /var>* All job actions unlocked through level 80 will also be available while in duty.<var 48 01 /var>

<var 48 08 /var><var 49 04 /var>■Resistance Rank<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
All players are subject to a separate leveling system while at the front, indicated by their “Resistance rank.” Performing admirably in large-scale battles such as skirmishes and critical engagements will increase your “mettle”─akin to experience points.
<var 48 0F /var>* Simply defeating imperial troops and beasts is not enough to prove your mettle─you must participate in successful military operations.<var 48 01 /var>

If you demonstrate sufficient mettle upon reporting to the Resistance commander, your Resistance rank will climb. Those of higher rank will gain access to more areas of the front, as well as additional quests.
<var 48 0F /var>* Your Resistance rank will not increase unless authorized by the commander, so don't forget to report for inspection!<var 48 01 /var>

<var 48 08 /var><var 49 04 /var>■Job Leveling<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
Upon successful completion of a military operation, you will gain regular experience points in addition to mettle. This experience will be applied to your job level as normal, so it is recommended that you consider using a job that has not yet reached level 80 to take advantage of experience point gains.

<var 48 08 /var><var 49 04 /var>■But Wait...<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>
More information is available from Sjeros in Gangos and your Resistance comrades at the southern front, so don't hesitate to converse with them!

The higher an item's collectability, the more attractive it is to certain NPCs who are seeking to purchase or trade for them. It should be noted, however, these items must meet a certain collectability threshold before they will be accepted by NPCs.
Selecting a collectable item in the gathering window will open the collectables interface. Here you can try to improve the item's collectability rating before adding it to your inventory.

Techniques such as <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Scour<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> can be employed to increase the collectability of an item. It should be noted, however, the gathering point's <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>integrity<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is diminished by the use of such actions. Integrity is also reduced when gathering items. One must be mindful of their actions to ensure integrity still remains after reaching a suitable collectability rating.

There are three key actions used to raise collectability, each of which reduces the gathering point's integrity by one.
Scour Increases collectability by a fixed amount determined by your gathering rating.
Brazen Prospector / Brazen Woodsman Increases collectability by a random amount that may be lower or significantly higher than Scour. A potentially efficient option when gathering in a location where your desired item can be found in abundance.
Meticulous Prospector / Meticulous Woodsman Increases collectability by a fixed amount lower than Scour. However, there is chance integrity is unaffected. A good option when you're certain your next action will reach the desired collectability rating.

When the item reaches a sufficient collectability rating, use the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Collect<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> action to gather the item and add it to your inventory. Be mindful, however, that the integrity of the gathering spot is reduced by one for every item gathered. When its integrity reaches zero, no more items can be gathered.
※You may fail to gather an item if its gathering rate is not 100%.

The effectiveness of collectable actions such as Scour can be enhanced further by first using <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Scrutiny<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. While this action does not affect the gathering point's integrity, it does cost GP. A higher perception rating will increase the potency of this action.

When using collectable actions, there is a chance to trigger <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Collector's Intuition<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, granting a bonus to collectability. The chance of triggering this bonus increases with a higher perception rating.
※You may also increase the chance of triggering this bonus by using Collector's Focus.

When using collectable actions, there is a chance you will be granted the effect of <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Collector's Standard<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. While under this effect, the potency of brazen and meticulous actions is increased significantly.

Raising collectability should not be your only focus when gathering collectables. Actions that increase gathering rate, as well as those that grant additional gathering attempts or restore integrity, are also essential to procure as many collectables as possible. Careful planning and effective use of all actions is the key to success for accomplished Disciples of the Land.

Prime collectable items that have reached maximum collectability will, on occasion, yield exceedingly rare items from aetherial reduction.
Moreover, these prime collectables may also become sublime when they are gathered with maximum collectability, which guarantees a yield of rare items from aetherial reduction.
A higher gathering rate increases your chances of a prime collectable becoming sublime.

The collectability of an item is another means of measuring its intrinsic quality.
Collectability required to deliver an item can be confirmed at the top right of the interface.
When breaking down items via aetherial reduction, this rating indicates the collectability required to obtain items other than crystals.

You can enter a variant or criterion dungeon via the V&C Dungeon Finder window, which is accessed by speaking with the NPC at the dungeon entrance, or by selecting the option from <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Duty<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> in the main menu.
This window features all the necessary information regarding dungeon entry, as well as the dungeon-specific settings.

The difficulty of a <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>variant dungeon<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> is automatically adjusted to provide a challenge for parties of between one to four players. Victory will require effort and attention, but it is entirely possible to complete these dungeons alone.
If you wish to enter as a solo player or with your current party members, be sure to uncheck the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Enable party matching<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> option (disabled by default). Conversely, enabling this option will match you with other adventurers to tackle the dungeon in a four-player party.

To allow for greater freedom in role choices, variant dungeons grant players the use of special <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>variant actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>.
These actions mimic existing abilities such as <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Cure<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> or <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Rampart<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, alleviating the need for dedicated tanks, DPS, or healers. Each player has two actions available for use during the dungeon, and these can be changed <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>at any time<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> via the <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Set Actions<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> button in the V&C Dungeon Finder window.

Variant dungeons feature <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>branching paths<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, and by exploring these choices alongside the quest character will you reveal new elements of the overarching story.
Upon completing each path, a new entry will be added to the journal or expedition log associated with the dungeon. Simply open the V&C Dungeon Finder window and select the character portrait to browse the completed entries.

You have unlocked <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>criterion dungeons<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, a tier of higher difficulties which can be accessed by switching the tab at the top of the V&C Dungeon Finder window.
Criterion dungeons have no accompanying NPC or branching paths to explore. In place of newly discovered story elements, the tab will instead display a list of available dungeons, as well as the amount of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>special currency<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> earned from completing these more punishing challenges.

Unlike variant dungeons, criterion dungeons <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>do not allow job changes<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>. Resurrection via Raise or other abilities is also restricted, being permitted only through use of the special action Variant Raise II.
Criterion dungeons of <var 48 F201FA /var><var 49 F201FB /var>Savage<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> difficulty disable the use of variant actions completely, and must be attempted by preformed four-player parties meeting the entry requirements.
